text: Recovery algorithms are techniques to ensure database consistency, transaction atomicity, and durability despite failures. Recovery algorithms have two parts: — Actions during normal txn processing to ensure that the DBMS can recover from a failure. —> Actions after a failure to recover the database to a state that ensures atomicity, consistency, and durability. ; \ — £ZCMU-DB —— IM D Pl 4% 526/1:1518 - CRASH RECOVERY > ® $ q O-c 20 - Database Logging Schemes (CMU Databases Systems / Fall 2019)
